value.title: Analyzing Performance Analyzer trace in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Learn how to import Performance Analyzer trace information in DAX Studio and find more insights about report performance. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Formula engine and storage engine in DAX
value.excerpt: Understanding the differences between the formula engine and the storage engine is the first step to understand the performance metrics and optimize a DAX formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/684038?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Naming temporary columns in DAX
value.excerpt: Discuss a naming convention for temporary columns in DAX expressions to avoid ambiguity with the measure reference notation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/377817?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Optimizing conditions involving blank values in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how blank values in a DAX conditional expression can affect its query plan and how to apply possible optimizations to improve performance in these cases. Article and download: https://sql.bi/483918?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX:

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Sorting months in fiscal calendars in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows a basic technique used to sort months according to a fiscal calendar, by using a couple of calculated columns and the ‚Äúsort by column‚Äù feature of Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/492713?aff=yt

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Working below a DAX formula‚Äôs granularity
value.excerpt: How to control the result of a DAX measure used in a report with granularity below the granularity supported by the formula. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661463/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Year-to-date filtering weekdays in DAX
value.excerpt: Time intelligence functions oftentimes hide an automatic ALL statement meant to make time intelligence calculations easier. This video describes this behavior and what to do in case it ends up breaking your calculation. Article and download: https://sql.bi/123591

value.title: Build a P&L in Power BI Without Any DAX
value.excerpt: This is the third article where I have covered building a P&L in Power BI. My first 2 articles here and here focused on how to use the DAX language to solve some of the common problems with P&L reporting, such as adding sub totals into the visual, % of [...]Read More ¬ª

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you‚Äôll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: Create a Dynamic Narrative with DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly create a dynamic narrative in minutes in Power BI. Use DAX to  add to the overall story telling of your data.
